page.title: 15WILDLIFE AROUND BLACKO
page.content: A variety of animals, birds and wild flowers can be found in this area. Animals include foxes, rabbits, hares and deer. The main forms of water life are Roach, Minnows, Toads, Eels, Loach, Snails, Trout, Frogs, Shrimp, Dragon Fly and Caddis Larvae. Resident Water Fowl on {WHITE MOOR {RESERVOIR}are Mallard, Teal, Coot and Canada Goose. Many Water Fowl visit the reservoir both during migration and to feed and roost during the winter months, the most common are:- Grebe, Tufted Duck, Merganser, Heron, Widgeon and Golden Eye. Other birds include Red Grouse, Meadow Pippit, Curlew, Pheasant, Lapwing and Woodcock. In the Spring and Summer the fields are full of Daisies,Dandelions and Buttercups. Wild Primroses, Violets and Bluebells can be found in the area.
